# maxValue

**Instance Property**

The maximum value the slider can send to its target.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var maxValue: Double { get set }
```

## Discussion

A horizontal slider sends its maximum value when the knob is at the right end of the slider; a vertical slider sends it when the knob is at the top. The maximum selectable value for a circular slider is just below [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSliderCell/maxValue]; for example, if [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSliderCell/maxValue] is 360, you can set the dial up to 359.999.

## Managing Value Limits

- **minValue**: The minimum value the slider can send to its target.
